Description: Cast polygonal weight in copper alloy; with flat base and top; concentric circles on top and underside; complete; slightly corroded
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This weight could correspond to 2 unciae, a Graeco-Roman standard (55 g), although the corrosion has likely altered the original mass (on bronze weights of the uncia standard discovered in Egypt: Cour-Marty 1985, 191). Cour-Marty, M.-A. 1985. ‘Informations et Documents’, Revue d’Egyptologie 36, 189-200.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (VB.285)
